fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article and, in early editions, an editorial cited a line from the UN report on poverty in the UK which stated that the Institute for Fiscal Studies predicted a 7% rise in child poverty between 2015 and 2022. The IFS predicted a 7 percentage point rise (Austerity has inflicted misery on people – UN, 17 November, page 1; The shameful truth is that the Tories chose austerity and made the poor pay, 19 November, page 2, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: ‘We put a remainer in to do Brexit’: view from Lisburn, Co Antrim John Kerry: Europe must tackle climate change or face migration chaos The Japanese beach that became an Instagram sensation
